references: total U.K. goods and services trade

justifications: Dr. Monique Ebell, former associate research director at the National Institute of Economic and Social Research, forecasted a -22% reduction in total U.K. goods and services trade if EU membership was replaced by a free trade agreement.

references: BRIICS (Brazil, Russia, India, Indonesia, China, and South Africa)

justifications: Ebell saw a pact with the BRIICS (Brazil, Russia, India, Indonesia, China, and South Africa) boosting total trade by 2.2%.

references: pact with the United States, Canada, Australia, and New Zealand

justifications: Ebell saw a pact with the United States, Canada, Australia, and New Zealand was expected to do slightly better, at 2.6%.
May presented the election as a chance for the Conservatives to solidify their mandate and strengthen their negotiating position with Brussels.

May batted away calls for her to leave her post, saying, 'It is clear that only the Conservative and Unionist Party has the legitimacy and ability to provide that certainty by commanding a majority in the House of Commons.'
The resulting hung Parliament cast doubts on May's mandate to negotiate Brexit and led the leaders of Labour and the Liberal Democrats to call on May to resign.

May batted away calls for her to leave her post, saying, 'It is clear that only the Conservative and Unionist Party has the legitimacy and ability to provide that certainty by commanding a majority in the House of Commons.'
David Davis resigned as Brexit secretary.
Boris Johnson resigned as Foreign Secretary in protest.
Politicians in Scotland pushed for a second independence referendum in the wake of the Brexit vote.
